paragraphs.zh-tw: 身為一位魔術師, 我所喜歡的魔術是運用科技來產生幻覺所以我要秀一段我已經玩了一陣子的東西
paragraphs.en: So the type of magic I like,and I'm a magician, is magic that uses technologyto create illusions. So I would like to show yousomething I've been working on.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 它是一個應用程式我想對藝術家很有用尤其是對多媒體藝術家它可以同步在數個行動裝置螢幕上播的影片
paragraphs.en: It's an application that I think will be useful for artists --multimedia artists in particular. It synchronizes videosacross multiple screens of mobile devices.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 我向現場的幾位觀眾借了三個iPod來表演並解釋我的意思還要藉此闡述一點點我最喜歡的題目欺騙
paragraphs.en: I borrowed these three iPodsfrom people here in the audience to show you what I mean. And I'm going to use them to tell youa little bit about my favorite subject: deception.

paragraphs.zh-tw: (音樂)有一位我很喜歡的魔術師叫做卡爾・日曼他的絕技是讓玫瑰花苞在你眼前盛開
paragraphs.en: (Music) One of my favorite magiciansis Karl Germain. He had this wonderful trickwhere a rosebush would bloom right in front of your eyes.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 但是他最厲害的還是變出一隻蝴蝶最令人驚艷(錄音)主持人:各位先生女士生命的創造(鼓掌)
paragraphs.en: But it was his production of a butterflythat was the most beautiful. (Recording) Announcer:Ladies and gentlemen, the creation of life.

paragraphs.zh-tw: (音樂)馬可: 有人問他對欺騙的看法他回答主持人: 魔術是世上唯一誠實的職業若一個魔術師承諾要騙你他就會騙你
paragraphs.en: (Music) Marco Tempest: When asked about deception, he said this: Announcer: Magicis the only honest profession. A magician promises to deceive you -- and he does.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 馬可: 我認為我是一個誠實的魔術師我運用多種手法也就是說有時候我得說假話
paragraphs.en: MT: I like to think of myselfas an honest magician. I use a lot of tricks, which means that sometimesI have to lie to you.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 而我對這事感到難過但是我們每天都在說謊
paragraphs.en: Now I feel bad about that. But people lie every day.

paragraphs.zh-tw: (電話鈴響) 等一下電話裡的女生: 嘿, 你在哪?馬可: 大塞車啊! 我很快就到了.
paragraphs.en: (Ringing) Hold on. Phone: Hey, where are you? MT: Stuck in traffic. I'll be there soon.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 你們一定都做過這事吧女士: 我馬上就好, 親愛的
paragraphs.en: You've all done it. (Music) Right: I'll be readyin just a minute, darling.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 男士: 這正是我想要的女生: 你氣色不錯
paragraphs.en: Center: It's just what I've always wanted. Left: You were great.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 馬可: 欺騙是生活的基本民意調查顯示男人說謊的次數比女人多兩倍假設這些受訪的女人都是說真話
paragraphs.en: MT: Deception, it's a fundamental part of life. Now polls show that men tell twiceas many lies as women -- assuming the womenthey asked told the truth.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 欺騙使我們取得優勢隱藏弱點中國的軍事家孫子說兵者詭道也
paragraphs.en: (Laughing) We deceive to gain advantage and to hide our weaknesses. The Chinese general Sun Tzu saidthat all war was based on deception.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 奧斯卡王爾德說愛情也是如此有些人為了錢行騙
paragraphs.en: Oscar Wilde saidthe same thing of romance. Some people deceive for money.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 我們來玩一個遊戲三張卡, 三次機會
paragraphs.en: Let's play a game. Three cards, three chances.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 主持人: 押5得10, 押10成雙現在紅心Q在哪?紅心皇后在哪?馬可: 這張嗎?抱歉, 你輸了
paragraphs.en: Announcer: One five will get you 10,10 will get you 20. Now, where's the lady? Where is the queen? MT: This one? Sorry. You lose.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 我沒有騙你喔是你自己騙了自己
paragraphs.en: Well, I didn't deceive you. You deceived yourself.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 自我欺騙是我們說服自己謊言是真的
paragraphs.en: Self-deception. That's when we convince ourselvesthat a lie is the truth.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 有時候的確很難分辨這兩者強迫性賭徒就是自我欺騙專家
paragraphs.en: Sometimes it's hard to tell the two apart. Compulsive gamblersare experts at self-deception.

paragraphs.zh-tw: (吃角子老虎的聲音)他們相信自己一定會贏卻忘了輸的時候
paragraphs.en: (Slot machine) They believe they can win. They forget the times they lose.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 大腦很會遺忘事物不好的經驗總是很快就忘了
paragraphs.en: The brain is very good at forgetting. Bad experiences are quickly forgotten.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 不好的經驗很快就消失了這就是為什麼在浩瀚宇宙中我們無可救藥的樂觀
paragraphs.en: Bad experiences quickly disappear. Which is why in this vastand lonely cosmos, we are so wonderfully optimistic.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 我們的自我欺騙是一個肯定性的錯覺為甚麼電影可以帶我們去一段非凡大冒險為什麼我們相信羅密歐說他愛茱麗葉為什麼簡單的音符可以串成一首奏鳴曲, 令人無限遐想這首曲子是"月光"作曲家叫德布西他說藝術是世上最偉大的騙術
paragraphs.en: Our self-deceptionbecomes a positive illusion -- why movies are able to take usonto extraordinary adventures; why we believe Romeowhen he says he loves Juliet; and why single notes of music, when played together, become a sonata and conjure up meaning. That's "Clair De lune." Its composer, called Debussy, said that art wasthe greatest deception of all.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 藝術是一種欺騙卻讓你產生真實的感動假語變真言而當你投身於如此的騙局
paragraphs.en: Art is a deceptionthat creates real emotions -- a lie that creates a truth. And when you give yourselfover to that deception, it becomes magic.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 我們稱之為魔術謝謝. 非常感謝.
paragraphs.en: [MAGIC] (Music fades slowly) Thank you. Thank you very much.

title: Marco Tempest The Magic Of Truth And Lies On Ipods
